snippet: The region’s leaders want their own legislature, budget, police and courts, with Benghazi as their capital, but the federal government would control foreign policy, the army and the oil.
abstract: Militia and tribal chiefs from eastern Libya demand a return to the loose federation that prevailed before Col Muammar el-Qaddafi took power four decades ago, under which they would enjoy significant legislative and executive autonomy; announce unilateral plans to establish their own state, Barqa, in defiance of the transitional government in Tripoli.

byline.original: By SULIMAN ALI ZWAY and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Alzway reported from Benghazi, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The region’s leaders want their own legislature, budget, police and courts, with Benghazi as their capital, but the federal government would control foreign policy, the army and the oil.

headline.seo: Eastern Libya Demands Measure of Autonomy
headline.main: Eastern Libya Demands a Measure of Autonomy in a Loose National Federation
headline.print_headline: Eastern Libya Demands a Measure of Autonomy in a Loose National Federation

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
